subject: incompatible types
msgSnippet: hi I have the following code: ======================================= import junit.framework.*; import java.util.*; public class Test extends TestCase {
messageBody:
hi

I have the following code:

=======================================

import junit.framework.*;
import java.util.*;

public class Test extends TestCase {
ArrayList a;
public Test(String name) {
super(name);
}
protected void setUp() {
a = new ArrayList();
}

public void test() {
assertTrue(a.size() == 8);
}

public static Test suite() {
return new TestSuite(Test.class); //This line shows incompatible types error
}

public static void main(String[] args) {
junit.textui.TestRunner.run(suite());
}
}
====================================================

When the above code was compiled, I got the error saying: " incompatible types found: junit.framework.TestSuite required : Test, return new TestSuite(Test.class)".

My understanding is: Test extends TestSuite. I am not sure why it complains at following line -----

return new TestSuite(Test.class);

I appreciate your help.
Thanks,
Nancy
